definitions.definition: Unable to see , or only partially able to see.
examples: Even a blind hen sometimes finds a grain of corn.
Braille is a writing system for the blind .

definitions.definition: Failing to recognize , acknowledge or perceive .
examples: The lovers were blind to each other’s faults.
Authors are blind to their own defects.

definitions.definition: Closed at one end; having a dead end ; exitless .
Having no openings for light or passage ; both dark and exitless.

examples: I shouted, but he didn’t take a blind bit of notice.
We pulled and pulled, but it didn't make a blind bit of difference.
definitions.label_groups: in certain phrases , chiefly in the negative

examples: He took a blind guess at which fork in the road would take him to the airport.
I went into the meeting totally blind , so I really didn’t have a clue what I was talking about.

definitions.definition: Unconditional ; without regard to evidence , logic, reality, accidental mistakes, extenuating circumstances, etc.
Using blinded study design, wherein information is purposely limited to prevent bias .

examples: a blind passage in a book; blind writing

definitions.definition: Abortive ; failing to produce flowers or fruit .

main_definition: ( not comparable ) Unable to see , or only partially able to see.
secondary_definitions: ( comparable ) Failing to recognize , acknowledge or perceive .
( not comparable , of a place ) Having little or no visibility .
( not comparable ) Closed at one end; having a dead end ; exitless .
( not comparable ) Having no openings for light or passage ; both dark and exitless.
( in certain phrases , chiefly in the negative ) Smallest or slightest .
( not comparable ) Without any prior knowledge.
( not comparable ) Unconditional ; without regard to evidence , logic, reality, accidental mistakes, extenuating circumstances, etc.
( sciences ) Using blinded study design, wherein information is purposely limited to prevent bias .
(Of a pimple ) not having a well-defined head .
( horticulture ) Abortive ; failing to produce flowers or fruit .
